Help to Buy is helping people get on the housing ladder:
27,000 have bought a new home; 85% first time buyers; 94% outside London.
Help to Buy is also getting new homes built: 74% of the deals are for new build homes. More jobs, more security and a brighter future.

#Charlemagne Prize goes beyond me personally: recognition of the courageous work of EU leaders & institutions fighting the financial crisis.
European Council & its summits make visible that the EU is not just Brussels, but 28 interdependent nations, intensely working together.
In a hypercompetitive world, EU must focus on right priorities: jobs & recovery, monetary union, climate & energy, freedoms & security.
I salute the courage of the PMs of #Ukraine, #Georgia, #Moldova during these tumultuous times. @Yatsenyuk_AP @PrimeMinisterGE @IurieLeanca
Europe's focus has been on space: free movement, possibilities. Needs to become a place as well, a home offering protection & belonging.
Knowing when to act as a Union & when not to, is a difficult balance. People expect sensible rules, fairly applied, & fight against abuses.
Overall message of European citizens to the European Union is clear: be stronger outside, be more caring inside.
Gemeinsame Aufgabe EU: mehr Stärke nach außen zeigen, mehr Behutsamkeit nach innen. #Karlspreis

A great deal has been done in the development of non-oil sector of Azerbaijan in recent years.
This has allowed us to form a large part of our economy today in the non-oil sector.
Our goal is to further develop, strengthen our country and create even stronger Azerbaijan. We are moving towards this goal successfully
Young people should be brought up in the spirit of patriotism. They will rule our country in the future.
Therefore, first of all, they must be homeland, love the homeland, be educated, educated.
Because if they are knowledgeable, literate, then no one can negatively affect their actions.
We know that today Azerbaijan has become a very important country in the world.
Many issues depend on our decisions.
That's why Azerbaijan has an attempt to pressure and influence our policy and it will be in the future.
We can never allow an initiative that conflicts with our interests.

@claynorway Yes. It's wrong. Climate quotas make it expensive to pollute and profitable to clean. Then green technology develops. Emissions cut
@Terje_Dypfest Yes, for example, Yara has cut emissions due to CO2 price. Quotas and CO2 tax have cut emissions in Norway m more mil tonnes.
@claynorway agree. Should cost more to contaminate.
@Terje_Dypfest ugly possible to have growth and reduced emissions. Conversion to the green economy will in itself lead to growth. Major investments.
@Lostartistic China is absolutely crucial. All the more positive that they now put in large measures. Investing in renewable and targeting climate quotas.
@Terje_Dypfest Yes, China is investing heavily in gaining CO2 by tackling emissions and introducing climate quotas. Will make a lot of money. @lostartistic
@abjartnes is very good that the sun becomes competitive. Climate quotas contribute to it because it becomes expensive to release CO2.
@GeirVoll certainly correct. We need more tools.
